data.title: A Chump at Oxford (1940)
data.meta_description: The boys get jobs as a butler and maid-- Stan in drag-- for a dinner party. When that ends in disaster, they resort to sweeping streets and accidentally capture a bank robber. The grateful bank president sends them to Oxford, at their request, and higher-education hijinks ensue.
data.text:
"Well, here we are at last. Right down in the gutter. I wonder what's the matter with us? We're just as good as other people, yet we don't seem to advance ourselves. We never get any place."

"You know what the trouble is, don't you? We've never had no education. That's what's the matter. You see, we're not alliterate enough."

"I guess you're right."

"Sure, I'm right! You see, if we went to school like other people, we-we would learn our three Rs, and today there'd be no job too small for us. Believe me."

"Whadda you mean, 'three Rs?'"

"Well, Reading, wRiting and... and... figuRin'."

As a Laurel & Hardy fan, A Chump at Oxford - which I haven't seen…

This film has an irrelevant prologue that sees Ollie as butler and Stan, in drag as a maid. All goes well until their employer, during a dinner party, asks Stan to serve the salad undressed...

The story proper sees the pair packed off to Oxford University as a reward for thwarting a bank robbery. The malicious English students first get them lost in a maze, where they have a hilarious confrontation with a ghost and then convince them that the rooms belonging to the university dean are in fact their student quarters. They then discover that Stan is really Lord Paddington, suffering from amnesia after a knock on the head.

There are three or four scenes of genuine comic genius…

This is the one where Stan can wiggle his ears and beat everyone up when, after bumping his head, he remembers he's actually Lord Paddington, a very clever, very sporty, very strong English Lord.

The boys are struggling to find work and bemoaning their lack of education. After a job as butler and maid (Stan in drag) goes disastrously wrong they end up sweeping the streets, but when they inadvertently capture a bank robber the bank rewards them by sending them to Oxford for an education.

The local students play tricks on them but then Stan becomes Lord Paddington and gets his revenge. He's treated as the hero of Oxford and retains Ollie (who he doesn't recognise) as a valet,…
